sponsor.partnerMessage: Fuel is a 12-week enterprise-ready accelerator that matches seed and growth-stage tech startups with key Arkansas enterprise partners in order to accelerate the adoption of tangible technology solutions.

posts.title: Community Created and Community Driven Sustainability
posts.content:
Ozark Compost was created to drive positive environmental impacts in NWA through convenient compost pickup and zero-waste product delivery. Join the hundreds of homes and businesses that have already diverted more than 80,000 lbs of food waste from local landfills with Ozark Compost.

  • Convenient composting: With easy-to-follow compost guides, customer support, and text notifications, composting could not be easier. Fill up your 5-gal bucket with compostable items, and OCS will pick it up and deliver a clean one weekly or bi-weekly. You can even receive givebacks for garden use.
  • Conscious consumption: Include a ground or whole-bean Airship coffee subscription with your deliveries, and find other eco-friendly, zero-waste products on Ozark Compost's online shop.

The first 10 NWA Daily readers to sign up will receive a free month of bi-weekly pickups. Add a coffee subscription, and we'll throw in a refillable coffee canister. Use code OCS2023 or click HERE.

posts.title: Circles NWA Celebrates Graduates Inaugural Cohort
posts.content:
Last month, Circles NWA celebrated the completion of its first cohort training designed to help people pursue upward mobility out of poverty.

  • Supporting goals: The cohort began in July 2021 with a 12-week training on financial literacy, after which the circle "leaders" were matched with "allies" from the community to support their journey toward achieving their goals. A second cohort launched last fall, and a third will begin in fall 2023.
  • Supporting each other: Believing that building community can end poverty, the Circles program builds intentional relationships across socioeconomic lines that help open up long-term pathways for economic mobility and self-sufficiency through social capital and community leadership.

Learn more and get involved with Circles NWA HERE.

posts.title: Gulley Park Concert Series Kicks Off This Thursday
posts.content:
It finally feels like summer in Fayetteville with the launch of the Gulley Park Concert Series, beginning this Thursday, Jun 8, from 7-9p.

  • Park party: Concerts will be hosted at the Gulley Park Gazebo every Thursday evening until Jul 13, where attendees can enjoy live music, a lineup of local food trucks, and an exciting new series of "Mini-Markets" with NWA Makers Gallery.
  • On stage: The season will kick off with John Fullbright, an acclaimed American singer-songwriter whose soulful blend of folk, country, and blues has earned him a Grammy nomination and widespread recognition for his authentic and introspective lyrics.

See the rest of the summer lineup HERE.

posts.title: AGFC's Free Fishing Weekend Begins Friday
posts.photoCredit: Wolf & Pine Co. | The Ozark Podcast
posts.content:
Drop a line this weekend during the Arkansas Game and Fish Commission's annual free fishing weekend, and fish anywhere in Arkansas without a fishing license or trout permit from noon on Friday, Jun 9, until midnight on Jun 11.

  • Arkansas angling: The annual tradition provides the opportunity to enjoy the world-class fishing that The Natural State has to offer. Regulations like daily limits, slot limits, and length limits still apply.
  • First cast: Northwest Arkansas is within an hour's drive of some of the best trout fishing in North America, but if you're just getting started, there are several AGFC stocked ponds located around Northwest Arkansas, such as Lake Bentonville, Lake Atalanta, and Shaw Family Park.

The Ozark Podcast is a great local resource to learn from men and women in the Ozarks with a passion for hunting, fishing, conservation, and more.

posts.title: Happy Founders Day Rogers
posts.content:
Today is Rogers Founders Day, and this month's Art on the Bricks will celebrate the city's creative individuals who have contributed to Rogers's rich and diverse cultural history on Thursday, Jun 8, from 4:30-7:30p.

  • Art founded: Rogers was officially founded on Jun 6, 1881, and has since been home to many creative individuals who have contributed to the city's cultural history in the arts, including painters, woodcarvers, sketch artists, quilters, and various other mediums.
  • Inside and out: Exhibitors will display art at Railyard Park Plaza and in over 20 businesses and galleries downtown, highlighting the creative talent of artists in the community. Stick around for live music during the Local Showcase Thursday at Butterfield Stage.

Explore an interactive map to find your way around Art on the Bricks HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• 🧥 Cool coat: Bentonville-based outdoor apparel company LIVSN Designs raised over $456K for its new Century Jacket on Kickstarter — Arkansas's second-largest crowdfunding campaign ever behind the company's own first-place record set in 2021.
  • 🎭 Doggone it: Arkansas Public Theatre presents Sylvia by A.R. Gurney with show dates running Jun 16-25.
  • 🏌️‍♀️ Fore! Volunteer registration and tickets for #NWAChampionship Week and BITE Experience @ LPGA go on sale today, Jun 6!
  • 🕺 Disco fever: JJ's Live is going full Disco on Friday, Jun 23, for its very first Disco Revival, playing all the favorite disco hits and disco remixes of current songs. Dress to impress for the Best Disco 'Fit competition!
  • 📅 Local happenings: Explore upcoming events mentioned in the newsletter, or post your own HERE!
  • 🎉 Biggest Fans: Help NWA Daily keep curating great content AND gain access to EXCLUSIVE giveaways – Become a Fan of NWA Daily.
  • 🚀 Launch your message out to NWA Daily's 29,100+ subscribers! Fill out this form or email us to learn about our advertising opportunities.
